title: Why are Turrets so worthless?
body:
Towers are literally the weakest they've ever been in the history of the game and yet champion mobility and power creep is the highest it's ever been. How is it that a level 4 champion can tower dive someone at 60% HP, kill them, and get away unscathed? Aren't towers suppose to punish that kind of shit? AT LEVEL 4??? What's the point of having ANY towers? They may as well be giant 2000-HP pink wards. 

Inb4 "but the game takes too long to end" when shit like Baron buff and {{item:3060}} exist. Games take long because solo queuers generally suck at grouping and taking objectives; they prefer to camp bushes for kills and take wolves instead. Towers are legitimately weak this season, like noticeably so.

Well, at level 1 GP (highest health in the game at level 1) can tank 3 turret shots (meaning that he dies at 4th) already - and that's without any items/runes and masteries.

At level 4 he can tank nearly 5 turret shots (he probably can take all 5 or even 6 with runes and masteries, but I don't feel like counting that much right now).

Hell, at level 4 with runes/masteries and a Doran's ring Teemo can tank 4 turret shots (dies at 5th).

And if you think that's not much then think about it like this:

It means that turret have to hit Teemo for over 6 seconds straight in order to kill him. At level 4.

Yes, turrets are weak.

Positioning is key and the only time those dives work is the enemy outplaying you, or you're an easy target, in which case yeah, it is greed that you decided to stay under turret to farm instead of just going back.

Tower diving can be frustrating but it is an essential strategic aspect for the early game.

One thing i fucking hate is that the last turrets at your base **(The ones that are supposed to BE EFFECTIVE BECAUSE THEY WILL DETERMINE IF YOU WIN OR LOSE)** can be shredded single-handedly by an adc like Tristana or Jinx. I'm not asking for all of the turrets to be buffed, but seriously, late game anyone will walk into the tower and just stand there for a couple of seconds while the last turrets a.k.a your last hope gets immediately shredded by anyone. The turrets near your nexus should be stronger. Instead, they're utter garbage and don't do anything. I should be able to rely on a turret late-game. Even when the enemy team is on their last push, you can't even camp under the nexus turrets at full hp because 5 people on the enemy team just nonchalantly walk in, take literally no damage and destroy you under the radius of what is supposed to be called "protection". The nexus turrets can barely kill a super minion for fucks sake, let alone a champion. I feel like if i'm under a turret, i should feel somewhat safe. Not a feeling of "holy shit, im going to get tower dived and won't be able to fend for myself". Plus, its fucking stupid how I recall and have to leave top lane for 2 minutes, i come back to see that the enemy top laner and the minions have done 3/4 of the turret's health for me being away for 2 minutes. Come on... Buff these bitches plz.
Yes, turrets should get stronger as you get closer to the base
Towers might as well shoot spaghettio's one at a time at you because they hit like a wet noodle (with the exception of the supremely squishy champs, E.G, Nami, Sona, etc)
Turrets are worthless because Riot hates Dyrus.

> How is it that a level 4 champion can tower dive someone at 60% HP, kill them, and get away unscathed?

They can't. 

The point of towers is to be objectives and control minions, not protecting you, you protect them.

Chances are if you got killed that easily and the enemy somehow didn't get hurt you are the one that messed up not the tower.

not entirely true. towers are also meant to stop one side from dominating lane early on. Yes they do help with minions put there also suppose to be a foothold for players to play safe if needed until either the game moves past towers being used as protection or the player can (hopefully) get caught up.  Without any significant risk to stop opponents from just diving you level 4 how can a player possibly manage to stay in lane?
